sub_title: Sr. Program Manager Quality, Capacity Improvements and Customer interface for ZEISS SMT
summary:
Business Professional with a strong business acumen built in supply chain, industrial, quality, customer and risk management and product & process development, in program, operational and corporate management positions in the semiconductor and electronic display industry.
Program Manager and first point of contact for ZEISS SMT at Sourcing and Supply Chain organization responsible for 
•	driving customer trust, product robustness and early risk reduction in new product introductions through leading the Quality Roadmap and Program for DUV and EUV ZEISS SMT Optics products (co-chair of Quality steering committee)
•	leading capacity ramp up projects for DUV lenses through product design, qualification and cycle time improvements at ZEISS SMT Optics manufacturing and their suppliers over system integration and test at ASML up to customer communication
•	creating awareness of the voice of the customer and fostering a quality mindset at ZEISS SMT through coordination of customer interactions (visit, audits, voice of the customer events) for ASML’s strategic partner ZEISS SMT. 
Builds trust and engages team, shapes alliances with supply chain partners and stakeholders through a long term vision, fostering partnership and open communication in daily work.
Oversees all phases of product life cycle management. Comprehensive knowledge and experience in key drivers of supply chain management (quality, logistics, technology, cost and sustainability). 
Certified as TUV Quality Manager and IRCA ISO9001 Lead Auditor, experienced in assessments and managing the global quality audit program executed by ASML’s computer chip making customers. 
Chemical engineer and German national with over 20 years of experience in supply chain, industrial, quality and risk management and new product introductions working for multinationals.
Enthusiastic personality with a passion for technology and the ability to engage others on a joint vision.
Intuitive thinker, who finds common interest between different parties in a complex environment, using diplomacy to align stakeholders to achieve a common goal.
Senior professional, who drives performance & leads change in a multi-cultural, dynamic environment.

school.name: FH Aachen University of Applied Sciences

courses.name: Senior Executive Program 2013/14: Strategy Excellence, Organizational Excellence, Leadership Excellence

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for driving quality strategy, roadmap and program, managing capacity ramp up initiatives and coordinate customer interactions at Optics suppliers resp. business partners: ZEISS SMT since 10/2019, Trumpf Semiconductors (10/2019 – 08/2021), Keysight (01/2021 – 06/2021).
•	Established a comprehensive Quality Roadmap and Program for strategic business partners ZEISS SMT and Trumpf Semiconductors based on a joint Quality Vision and Mission and as chair of joint Quality Steerco (Quality Performance Management, co-owned Quality initiatives, annual Quality ambition / target setting, Regular Performance and Project reviews).
•	Lead an Upstream Quality program for Projection Optics Box delivering a breakthrough in reducing production time loss at ASML factory 
•	Contributed to a breakthrough in DL install time at ASML EUV factory through establishing a quality feedback loop to business partner / supplier, organizing Gembas at ASML and Trumpf factory & warehouse
•	Improved Material Quality Performance from ZEISS SMT DUV and EUV Optics products. 
•	Rolled out SPC / Trendwatch to DUV projection lenses and EUV projection and illumination modules accelerating learning loop.
•	Drives together with Head of QM at supplier / business partner annual Quality Ambition, Target setting and Quality Roadmap. 
•	Drives strategic decisions in close collaboration with Head of QM resp. Product Line Manager at supplier / business partner at joint 6 weekly BL Review and quarterly Operations Review meeting.
•	Drives customer satisfaction through leading product robustness, process and CT improvements (e.g. DUV immersion projection lenses).
•	Facilitates customer visits / audits and VoC events at supplier / business partner fostering quality culture.
•	Contributed to DD ramp up in DUV Optics leading a multidisciplinary ASML-ZEISS team who delivered significant CT reduction for ArFi immersion lenses thereby securing system output and product quality of ASML’s Twinscan factory.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Program Manager Quality, Capacity Improvements and Customer interface for ZEISS SMT

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for worldwide program of audits and quality related visits executed by top computer chip makers to drive customer satisfaction, product robustness and process efficiency at ASML reporting to Director Global Quality Assessments.
•	Deploys the Voice of the Customer into ASML business sectors. Facilitates and drives end to end business improvements from customer audits and quality related visits by engaging key stakeholders in preparation, execution and follow up of quality audits / quality related visits executed by top chip computer makers.
•	Executes self-assessments to identify gaps and opportunities. Identifies systemic quality themes and initiates cross functional improvements.
•	Coordinates planning of customer audits and quality related visits of computer chip makers. Provides Management oversight reporting on audit follow up for timely audit follow up, closure of process gaps and product improvements.
•	Developed a tailor made integral Quality Audit strategy for ASML as high-tech company.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager Global Quality Customer Audit

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for Quality and Process Improvement Support and Quality strategy for BL EUV, member of Corporate Quality staff reporting to VP Quality and VP BL EUV Development & Engineering.
•	Installed Quality management in EUV Product Development Teams via dedicated Quality Managers.
•	Launched structural Quality Reviews and customer complaint management in BL EUV.
•	Developed a Quality Assurance Strategy for Product Development & Engineering in the High Tech Industry.
•	Hired and developed a high performing Quality (Assurance) Team consisting of Quality Improvement Managers and Assessors.
•	Identified gaps & initiated improvements in product & industrial specifications, risk management by FMEA and supplier quality management by driving quality assessments of critical EUV modules.
•	Coordinated customer and annual ISO 9001 surveillance / certification audits for BL EUV.
•	Worldwide FMEA process and competence owner responsible for FMEA deployment and state-of-the-art FMEA methodology in ASML.
profile_positions.title: Director Quality & Process Improvement for BL EUV

profile_positions.description:
•	Member of the Corporate Quality staff reporting to VP Quality responsible for Quality strategy of R&D (Development & Engineering, Systems Engineering and Product Development Programs) and for worldwide FMEA competence (01.02-2013 – 30.03.2017)
•	Developed the quality assessment / audit competence and a quality assurance methodology  for a high-tech innovation environment.
•	Managed the assessments of 65 Project Leads concerning competence and deployment of the ASML Product Generation Process, secure gap closure via process trainings. 
•	Lead the implementation of business process management in the product generation process area using ARIS. Drove completion of business processes from 23 to >= 88 %.
•	Improved the quality of decision making at key decision in the product generation process by assessing Key decision inputs and process improvements.
•	Set up an operational excellence framework for quality and process improvements in R&D. Organized Quality workshops with Quality Managers and specialists across R&D in order to deploy the Corporate Quality strategy, identify and share best practices and build quality competence. 
•	Strengthened the risk management competence in R&D by systematic embedding of Design and Process FMEA in all product development programs from FMEA definition, over FMEA facilitation, risk prioritization up to timely risk mitigation at key decisions.
•	Introduced a database oriented FMEA system, integrated in ASML document and issue resolution management systems.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Manager Quality & Process Improvement for Product Creation and FMEA competence owner

profile_positions.description:
6” wafer fab (01.12.2008-31.3.2011)
8” wafer fab (01.04.2007-30.11.2008)

•	Member of the Operations staff reporting to Operations Manager of a major European 6” (resp. 8”) waferfab (production capacity: 433k 8” wafers / year)
•	Delivered a double digit annual capacity & productivity improvement in 8” and 6” waferfab driving capacity ramp up speed and process mix flexibility thereby enabling process transfers from restructuring of US and European sister factories.
•	Directed the simulation of long-term loading & capacity scenarios in cooperation with consultants as input to mid-term operations strategy.
•	Delivered key contributions to the transformation and qualification of 8” waferfab as automotive supplier via international workshops for process transfers, gate reviews, organizing automotive mindset trainings for employees and driving a factory wide 5S program.
•	Delivered improved demand forecasting and capacity review by implementing weekly Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) system in 8” wafer fab using advanced global business planning engine (I2).
•	Drove the development of cost models in order to advise management on the profitability of the process / product mix.
•	Deployed Six Sigma to the shopfloor by launching a Yellow Belt program for technicians and supervisors.
profile_positions.title: Production Control, Fab Support and Industrial Engineering Manager at 8"/6" Waferfab

profile_positions.description:
•	Member of the engineering staff of the four waferfabs (4”, 5”, 6”, 8”) reporting to the Engineering Manager of Industrial Center Nijmegen, responsible for cross factory improvements in order to drive a standard WoW, identification and sharing of best practices and expertise.
•	Delivered a 50 % reduction in improvement project throughput time by establishing a more effective and efficient project & portfolio management governance incl. a project office, training, coaching and tooling.
•	Launched a Green Belt program in the 8” wafer fab. Delivered within 2 years 33 Green Belts with several hundred thousand Euro annual savings in 8” waferfab.
•	Made a key contribution to transform the 8” wafer fab from a consumer into an automotive waferfab by improving FMEA based risk management towards ISO/TS16949 requirements, standardizing and deploying FMEA over 4 waferfabs.
•	Achieved a double digit increase in uptime of wafer coater systems in Lithography module (70 % to > 80 %) via a breakthrough approach in annual tool refurbishment. Implemented a ‘Pitstop’ way of working with improved planning, risk management, multifunctional and dedicated teams and clear coordination to speed up the learning cycle.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Improvement Manager for Nijmegen Waferfabs

profile_positions.description:
•	Member of the European HQ Operations staff, reporting to the Chief Industrial Officer (2001/02)/ European Operations Manager (2003/04) responsible for the manufacturing excellence program targeting the European and Brazilian (2005) picture tube and component factories. 
•	Drove under major restructuring conditions (closure of 1 European operation per year) the industrial performances to the maximum (factory efficiency, material consumption, organizational cost, product quality, flawless product launch).
•	Achieved a breakthrough in factory efficiency and yield improvement in European picture tube and component factories by
       o	supporting benchmarks of Korean picture tube factories in order to share best practice and identifying improvement opportunities
       o	driving the success of task force teams at the German and French picture tube factories.
       o	paying regular visits to the European factories in Germany, France, UK and Czech to review the operations progress, coach the local teams and coordinate technical and management support in order to realize breakthrough improvements
      o	contributing to the budgeting process, monthly operations review and the product road mapping process
      o	organizing international ‘Manufacturing Excellence’ workshops for manufacturing, engineering and quality managers of European and Brazilian factories in order to learn from best practices in labor productivity, maintenance management (TPM), turnaround management and 5S breakthrough improvements.
•	Contributed to the preparation and risk management for the restructuring of the European picture tube factories by identifying critical competences.
•	Reviewed the progress and risk management of new product introductions in order to drive flawless product launch.
•	Lead the negotiation of supplier quality agreements between picture tube and internal component suppliers.
•	Organized the business competition including for the European Picture Tube Factories.
profile_positions.title: Industrial & Innovation Manager of Operatons Management team at European Headquarters, Eindhoven

company.name: Philips Electronics Industries (Hsinchu, Taiwan) Ltd. \ DCD

profile_positions.company: Philips Electronics Industries (Hsinchu, Taiwan) Ltd. \ DCD
profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for the development and industrialization of new process technologies for production yield improvements in colour monitor tube manufacturing reporting to the department head ‘Brightness & Contrast’.
•	Developed and implemented a new exposure technology (front side exposure) delivering a significant yield improvement within ½ year, leading a team of 8 Taiwanese engineers and technicians.
•	Developed the respective exposure equipment in cooperation with a local Taiwanese equipment manufacturer after a benchmarking visit at a Japanese competitor factory (M.E.C.).
•	Improved the colloidal suspension properties of luminescent powders for optimum screen processing performance in colour monitor tube manufacturing in cooperation with Japanese suppliers (Nichia / Kasei).
•	Got promoted to Integral Project Lead for the development, industrialization and market launch of the strategically important first 17” real flat colour monitor tube (17” Cybertube) with a capital investment of several Million US$, leading an international multi-disciplinary project team of 10 people.
•	Reported to the Manager of the Development Center and to the Regional Managing Director of the Asia Pacific region as project principal. 
•	Delivered the market launch of the first flat 17” Cybertube within benchmark time to market of 1 year under challenging restructuring conditions (factory closure).
•	Achieved competitive quality and cost performances meeting budget requirements.
•	Supported the industrialization, transfer and the start of volume production in two foreign sister factories in Austria (Lebring) and Mainland China (Nanking).
•	Developed a local Taiwanese company as second source for high precision CNC machining of a critical component (shadow mask) enabling a breakthrough in development time and product cost.
profile_positions.title: Section Manager & Integral Project Manager for 17" Cybertube in Computer Monitor Tube development
